eg.plugin

Class EditorAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.plugin.EditorAccess

  • public class EditorAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    Makes accessible for a plugin methods to work with the text that is currently viewed in the main window's text area (i.e., the opened or tab selected document).

    Also includes the possibility to add a Component to the 'function panel' in the main window.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text content in the currently viewed text area
        Returns:
        the text content in the currently viewed text area. The returned text is contained in the StyledDocument associated with the JTextPane that displays the text

      • enableTypeEdit

        public void enableTypeEdit(boolean isEnabled)
        Enables/disables keywords coloring during typing in the currently viewed text area
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - true/false to enable/disable keywords coloring

      • textToBlack

        public void textToBlack(int length,
                        int pos)
        (Re-)colors the text starting at the specified position and spanning the specified length in the default color in the currently viewed text area
        Parameters:
        length - the length of text that is colored in the default color
        pos - the position where the text to color starts

      • colorSearchedText

        public void colorSearchedText(java.lang.String[] searchTerms,
                              boolean constrainWord)
        Colors in keyword color text elements specified by the array of search terms and turns on coloring during typing in the currently viewed text area.

        The current language must be plain text.

        Parameters:
        searchTerms - the array of Strings that contain search terms
        constrainWord - true to color only words

      • colorAll

        public void colorAll()
        Colors keyword/syntax in the entire text that is currently viewed

      • insertStr

        public void insertStr(int pos,
                      java.lang.String toInsert)
        Inserts text in the document that is currently viewed
        Parameters:
        pos - the position where new text is inserted
        toInsert - the String that contains the text to insert

      • removeStr

        public void removeStr(int start,
                      int length)
        Removes text from the document that is currently viewed
        Parameters:
        start - the position where text to be removed starts
        length - the length of the text to be removed

      • requestFocus

        public void requestFocus()
        Asks the currently viewed text area to gain the focus

        public void addToFunctionPanel(java.awt.Component c,
                               java.lang.String title)
        Adds a Component to the 'function panel' in the main window.
        Parameters:

        title - the title for the function
